Name of the character set to get the encoding for

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.ICloneable.Clone
member.summary: Creates a clone of this MySqlCommand object. CommandText, Connection, and Transaction properties are included as well as the entire parameter list.
member.returns: The cloned MySqlCommand object

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.Cancel
member.summary: Attempts to cancel the execution of a MySqlCommand. This operation is not supported.
member.remarks: Cancelling an executing command is currently not supported on any version of MySQL.

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.CreateParameter
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a object.
member.remarks: This method is a strongly-typed version of .
member.returns: A object.

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.Consume
member.summary: Executes all remaining command buffers

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.GetNextResultSet(MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDataReader)
member.summary: Executes command buffers until we hit the next resultset
member.returns: CommandResult containing the next resultset when hit or null if no more resultsets were found

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.CheckState
member.summary: Check the connection to make sure - it is open - it is not currently being used by a reader - and we have the right version of MySQL for the requested command type

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.SerializeParameter(MySql.Data.MySqlClient.PacketWriter,System.String)
member.summary: Serializes the given parameter to the given memory stream
member.param: PacketWriter to stream parameter data to
Name of the parameter to serialize

remarks.para: This method is called by PrepareSqlBuffers to convert the given parameter to bytes and write those bytes to the given memory stream.

member.returns: True if the parameter was successfully serialized, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.PrepareSqlBuffers(System.String)
member.summary: Prepares the necessary byte buffers from the given CommandText
member.returns: Array of byte buffers, one for each SQL command
member.remarks: Converts the CommandText into an array of tokens using TokenizeSql and then into one or more byte buffers that can be sent to the server. If the server supports batching (and we have enabled it), then all commands result in a single byte array, otherwise a single buffer is created for each SQL command (as separated by ';'). The SQL text is converted to bytes using the active encoding for the server.

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.PrepareCommandText(System.String)
member.summary: Prepares CommandText for use with the Prepare method
member.returns: Command text stripped of all paramter names
member.remarks: Takes the output of TokenizeSql and creates a single string of SQL that only contains '?' markers for each parameter. It also creates the parameterMap array list that includes all the paramter names in the order they appeared in the SQL

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand.TokenizeSql(System.String)
member.summary: Breaks the given SQL up into 'tokens' that are easier to output into another form (bytes, preparedText, etc).
member.param: SQL to be tokenized
member.returns: Array of tokens
member.remarks: The SQL is tokenized at parameter markers ('?') and at (';') sql end markers if the server doesn't support batching.

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommandBuilder.DeriveParameters(MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlCommand)
member.summary: Retrieves parameter information from the stored procedure specified in the MySqlCommand and populates the Parameters collection of the specified MySqlCommand object. This method is not currently supported since stored procedures are not available in MySql.
member.param: The MySqlCommand referencing the stored procedure from which the parameter information is to be derived. The derived parameters are added to the Parameters collection of the MySqlCommand.
member.exception: The command text is not a valid stored procedure name.

member.summary: Simple XOR scramble
member.param: Source array
Index inside source array
Destination array
Index inside destination array
Password used to xor the bits
Number of bytes to scramble

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.Crypt.Get410Password(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Generate a scrambled password for 4.1.0 using new passwords
member.param: The password to scramble
The seedbytes used to scramble
member.returns: Array of bytes containing the scrambled password

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.Crypt.GetOld410Password(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Generates a proper hash for old style 4.1.0 passwords. This would be used if a 4.1.0 server contained old 16 byte hashes.
member.param: The password to hash
Seed bytes received from the server
member.returns: Byte array containing the password hash

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.Crypt.Get411Password(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a byte array containing the proper encryption of the given password/seed according to the new 4.1.1 authentication scheme.

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.Crypt.EncryptPassword(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encrypts a password using the MySql encryption scheme
member.param: The password to encrypt
The encryption seed the server gave us
Indicates if we should use the old or new encryption scheme

member.name: M:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.Crypt.Hash(System.String)
member.summary: Hashes a password using the algorithm from Monty's code. The first element in the return is the result of the "old" hash. The second element is the rest of the "new" hash.
member.param: Password to be hashed
member.returns: Two element array containing the hashed values

The index for buffer to begin the read operation.
The maximum length to copy into the buffer.

member.name: P:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlTransaction.Connection
member.summary: Gets the object associated with the transaction, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the transaction is no longer valid.
member.value: The object associated with this transaction.
member.remarks: A single application may have multiple database connections, each with zero or more transactions. This property enables you to determine the connection object associated with a particular transaction created by .

member.name: P:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlTransaction.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Specifies the for this transaction.
member.value: The for this transaction. The default is ReadCommitted.
member.remarks: Parallel transactions are not supported. Therefore, the IsolationLevel applies to the entire transaction.

member.name: T:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType
member.summary: Specifies MySQL specific data type of a field, property, for use in a .

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.VarString
member.summary: A variable-length string containing 0 to 65535 characters

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Timestamp
member.summary: A timestamp. The range is '1970-01-01 00:00:00' to sometime in the year 2037

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.LongBlob
member.summary: A BLOB or TEXT column with a maximum length of 4294967295 or 4G (2^32 - 1) characters

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Time
member.summary:
Time
The range is '-838:59:59' to '838:59:59'.

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.TinyBlob
member.summary: A BLOB or TEXT column with a maximum length of 255 (2^8 - 1) characters

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Datetime
member.summary: DateTime The supported range is '1000-01-01 00:00:00' to '9999-12-31 23:59:59'.

summary.para: A fixed precision and scale numeric value between -1038 -1 and 10 38 -1.

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Blob
member.summary: A BLOB or TEXT column with a maximum length of 65535 (2^16 - 1) characters

summary.para: A normal-size (double-precision) floating-point number. Allowable values are -1.7976931348623157E+308 to -2.2250738585072014E-308, 0, and 2.2250738585072014E-308 to 1.7976931348623157E+308.

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Newdate
member.summary: Obsolete Use Datetime or Date type

summary.para: The signed range is -128 to 127. The unsigned range is 0 to 255.

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Date
member.summary: Date The supported range is '1000-01-01' to '9999-12-31'.

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.VarChar
member.summary: A variable-length string containing 0 to 255 characters

summary.para: A 16-bit signed integer. The signed range is -32768 to 32767. The unsigned range is 0 to 65535

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.NewDecimal
member.summary: New Decimal

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Set
member.summary: A set. A string object that can have zero or more values, each of which must be chosen from the list of values 'value1', 'value2', ... A SET can have a maximum of 64 members.

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.String
member.summary: Obsolete Use VarChar type

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Enum
member.summary: An enumeration. A string object that can have only one value, chosen from the list of values 'value1', 'value2', ..., NULL or the special "" error value. An ENUM can have a maximum of 65535 distinct values

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Int24
member.summary: Specifies a 24 (3 byte) signed or unsigned value.

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Bit
member.summary: Bit-field data type

summary.para: A small (single-precision) floating-point number. Allowable values are -3.402823466E+38 to -1.175494351E-38, 0, and 1.175494351E-38 to 3.402823466E+38.

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.Year
member.summary: A year in 2- or 4-digit format (default is 4-digit). The allowable values are 1901 to 2155, 0000 in the 4-digit year format, and 1970-2069 if you use the 2-digit format (70-69)

member.name: F:MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlDbType.MediumBlob
member.summary: A BLOB or TEXT column with a maximum length of 16777215 (2^24 - 1) characters
